data.question: What is the full name of MOF-76?
What anion shows the highest luminescence enhancement in MOF-76b?
Is MOF-76a less sensitive to fluoride than MOF-76b?
What is the role of Tb3+ in MOF-76?
data.answer: Provides the basic luminescence arising from the electronic transitions among the 4f orbitals.

data.question: Can MOF-76b be regenerated for further anion sensing?
What method was used to collect intensity data for F- incorporated MOF-76b?
Does the addition of F- enhance the luminescence intensity of MOF-76b?
What is the effect of hydrogen bonding interaction between O-H and anions in MOF-76b?
Is the luminescence mechanism of MOF-76 detailed in the Supporting Information?
What is the excitation peak wavelength for MOF-76b?
Does MOF-76b show a differential luminescence response to various anions?
What is the role of BTC ligands in MOF-76?
data.answer: They act as antenna chromophores for intramolecular energy transfer.

data.question: Is the Tb−F bond distance within MOF-76b longer than typical Tb−F bond distances?
What solvent is used for the regeneration of MOF-76b?
Does MOF-76b exhibit a higher luminescence intensity for F- compared to Cl-?
What is the significance of the O−H bond stretching within terminal methanol molecules in MOF-76b?
data.answer: It can be tuned by a differential amount of F- to enhance luminescence intensity.

data.question: Are the positions of fluoride anions within MOF-76b precisely located in the crystal structure?
What is the main purpose of MOF-76 according to the text?
data.answer: For the recognition and sensing of anions.

data.question: Can MOF-76b's luminescence be sensitized by BTC ligands?
What is the effect of changing the terminal solvent in MOF-76 on its sensing function?
data.answer: It tunes the interactions between the terminal solvents and fluoride anions.
